ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk61:1.1_0: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk61:1.2_0: At that time the monks from the group of six gave teachings to people wearing shoes. ...
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk61:1.3.1_0: “‘I will not give a teaching to anyone wearing shoes who is not sick,’ this is how you should train.”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk61:1.4_0: One should not give a teaching to anyone wearing shoes who is not sick.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk61:1.5_0: If a monk, out of disrespect, gives a teaching to someone who is not sick and who is standing on shoes, whose shoes are fastened, or whose shoes are loose, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk61:1.6.1_0: there is no offense for him.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk61:1.8_0: if he is the first offender.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk61:1.9_0: The first training rule is finished.
